CatDescriptText: The broadside behind Harper and Wein reads: "The Pittsburgh Jazz Festival Presented by George Wein Newport Jazz Festival and Association With Walt Harper, July 13th & 14th, 197? At Three Rivers Stadium, Friday July 13 at . . .8?, Ray Charles, Stevie Wonder, B.B. King, Charles Mingus, Freddie Hubbard". There is a large poster in background with a picture of Jacques Brel, that reads "Every Wednesday & Thurs., Sat. Matinee at 2:30, Walt Harper, 9 pm till 2 pm, Jacques Brel is . . .well & Living in Paris".Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 12, 1973, pg. 20, reads: "To Promote Jazz Festival - Internationally-known jazz promoter George Weing [Wein] (left) of New York City, and popular local jazz entrepreneur Walt Harper congratulate each other after signing a pact to produce a Pittsburgh Jazz Festival July 13-14 at the Three Rivers Stadium.  The announcement was made at a press party last Wednesday at Walt Harper's Attic in Market Square."
TitMainTitle: George Wein and Walt Harper shaking hands, with broadside for Pittsburgh Jazz Festival and Jacques Brel in background, in Walt Harper's Attic, Market Square, Downtown
